issue.title: GetMappedAS(...) lookup on an IPv6 address against a maliciously constructed AS-map triggers heap buffer-overflow
issue.body:
Very glad to see that `-asmap` was [merged](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16702) yesterday!

I noticed that it is possible to trigger a heap buffer-overflow when doing a `GetMappedAS(...)` lookup on an IPv6 address against a maliciously constructed AS-map.

Looking up the mapped AS-number for IPv6 address `dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead` ...

```c++
CNetAddr net_addr;
const std::vector<uint8_t> b = {222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173, 222, 173};
net_addr.SetRaw(NET_IPV6, b.data());
assert(net_addr.ToString() == "dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead:dead");
const std::vector<bool> asmap = {true, true, true, true, false, true, false, false};
(void)net_addr.GetMappedAS(asmap);
```

... yields ...

```
==957==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x6020000001a0 at pc 0x55aef2adf02a bp 0x7ffdbab92400 sp 0x7ffdbab923f8
READ of size 8 at 0x6020000001a0 thread T0
    #0 0x55aef2adf029 in std::_Bit_reference::operator bool() const /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/stl_bvector.h:83:17
    #1 0x55aef2adedf6 in std::_Bit_const_iterator::operator*() const /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/stl_bvector.h:323:14
    #2 0x55aef2ade2ac in (anonymous namespace)::DecodeBits(std::_Bit_const_iterator&, unsigned char, std::vector<unsigned char, std::allocator<unsigned char> > const&) src/util/asmap.cpp:18:19
    #3 0x55aef2add49e in (anonymous namespace)::DecodeType(std::_Bit_const_iterator&) src/util/asmap.cpp:40:12
    #4 0x55aef2add49e in Interpret(std::vector<bool, std::allocator<bool> > const&, std::vector<bool, std::allocator<bool> > const&) src/util/asmap.cpp:73:18
    #5 0x560f2052b833 in CNetAddr::GetMappedAS(std::vector<bool, std::allocator<bool> > const&) const src/netaddress.cpp:433:26

```

events.body: @practicalswift Does the added commit in #18023 fix this?

I've recreated the same issue as @practicalswift (happens immediately).

```bash
#2607	NEW    cov: 1194 ft: 2098 corp: 30/471b lim: 21 exec/s: 0 rss: 30Mb L: 20/21 MS: 1 ChangeBinInt-
=================================================================
==37374==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x602000029d98 at pc 0x000106d510db bp 0x7ffee8f05a20 sp 0x7ffee8f05a18
READ of size 8 at 0x602000029d98 thread T0
    #0 0x106d510da in std::__1::__bit_const_reference<std::__1::vector<bool, std::__1::allocator<bool> > >::operator bool() const __bit_reference:140
    #1 0x106d51ea2 in (anonymous namespace)::DecodeBits(std::__1::__bit_iterator<std::__1::vector<bool, std::__1::allocator<bool> >, true, 0ul>&, unsigned char, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> > const&) asmap.cpp:27
    #2 0x106d50d00 in Interpret(std::__1::vector<bool, std::__1::allocator<bool> > const&, std::__1::vector<bool, std::__1::allocator<bool> > const&) asmap.cpp:46
    #3 0x106d2629f in CNetAddr::GetMappedAS(std::__1::vector<bool, std::__1::allocator<bool> > const&) const netaddress.cpp:433
    #4 0x106d0a1c4 in test_one_input(std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> > const&) asmap.cpp:27
    #5 0x106cfabb4 in LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput fuzz.cpp:38
    #6 0x106db50d0 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::ExecuteCallback(unsigned char const*, unsigned long) FuzzerLoop.cpp:553
    #7 0x106db4935 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::RunOne(unsigned char const*, unsigned long, bool, fuzzer::InputInfo*, bool*) FuzzerLoop.cpp:469
    #8 0x106db69e6 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::MutateAndTestOne() FuzzerLoop.cpp:695
    #9 0x106db7655 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::Loop(std::__1::vector<fuzzer::SizedFile, fuzzer::fuzzer_allocator<fuzzer::SizedFile> >&) FuzzerLoop.cpp:831
    #10 0x106da3d18 in fuzzer::FuzzerDriver(int*, char***, int (*)(unsigned char const*, unsigned long)) FuzzerDriver.cpp:825
    #11 0x106dd05c2 in main FuzzerMain.cpp:19
    #12 0x7fff71b543d4 in start (libdyld.dylib:x86_64+0x163d4)
```

Testing with [master](3e1bf71064ccb98d0684753e844c80d6da421287) + #18029 + #18023 I no-longer see an immediate fuzzing related crash.
@sipa You might want to run `src/test/fuzz/asmap` (#18029) to verify any robustness fixes -- libFuzzer is amazing :)

Reproduced, heap overflow found almost immediately.
```
#796	NEW    cov: 961 ft: 2024 corp: 51/110Kb exec/s: 398 rss: 69Mb L: 92/4096 MS: 3 InsertByte-ChangeByte-InsertRepeatedBytes-
=================================================================
==4105==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x602000017998 at pc 0x55a231e658c3 bp 0x7fff64f8ff60 sp 0x7fff64f8ff58
READ of size 8 at 0x602000017998 thread T0
    #0 0x55a231e658c2 in std::_Bit_reference::operator bool() const /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/stl_bvector.h:83:17
```
@practicalswift Would be nice to get the inputs submitted to https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets, so that this issue can be closed
@MarcoFalke I believe it should be among the inputs already submitted by now. Closing :)
